title: Nicholas Saunderson

According to one historian of statistics, he may have been the earliest discoverer of Bayes' theorem.[2]   He worked as Lucasian Professor of Mathematics at Cambridge University, a post also held by Isaac Newton, Charles Babbage and Stephen Hawking.
